title: Atomic reason for large third ionization energy

content.prompt: For element X represented above, which of the following is the most likely explanation for the large difference between the second and third ionization energies?

choices.label: The effective nuclear charge decreases with successive ionizations.
The shielding of outer electrons increases with successive ionizations.
The electron removed during the third ionization is, on average, much closer to the nucleus than the first two electrons removed were.
The ionic radius increases with successive ionizations.

skill.text: 4.A: Predict and/or explain chemical properties or phenomena (e.g., of atoms or molecules) using given chemical theories, models, and representations.
